dialogues.text: PROFESSOR HAROLD OXLEY looks nothing like the conservativ archeology professor we saw in the photo. He’s got wild, rimmed eyes, his cheeks are sunken and his clothes hang f skeletal form. He starts to dance with a musical pole.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Ox? Ox! It’s me, Indy. (ox)You’re faking it, right pal? Oxley won’t even look at Indy. His eyes are wild, they ne rest, never make eye contact. Oxley dances towards Indy.

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: Through eyes that last I saw in tears... Indy pulls Oxley close, lowers his voice.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: (Ox)Listen to me pal, your name is Harold Oxley, you were born in Leeds, England. You and I went to school together at the University of Chicago, and you were never this interesting! My name is Indi- (though it pains him) My name is Henry Jones Junior But Oxley just spins away and he’s off again, dancing aro and, MUTTERING unintelligibly. Indy whirls on Mac and Spa INDY (cont’d) What have you done to him?!

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: We ain’t done a thing, it’s the bloody skull.

dialogues.speaker: SPALKO
dialogues.text: He is a divining nod that will lead us to Akator. But we need someone to interpret him for us. His mind, it seems, is quite weak. Let’s hope yours is stronger.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ee

dialogues.speaker: INT LARGER TENT NIGHT
dialogues.text: Dovchenko catches Indy’s hat. Spalko moves to a table, In backpack is resting on it. Spalko opens the backpack and pulls the CRYSTAL SKULL, sh it in her arms and walks towards Indy. The lamps all move towards the skull. Indy is in the chair still strapped, he is now wearing a across his head, attached to electrodes to his temples an frontal lobe.

dialogues.speaker: SPALKO
dialogues.text: The skull’s crystal stimulates an undeveloped part of the human brain, opening a psychic channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spalko turns the skull to face Indy. The lensed eye socke catch the light and glow intensely. Spalko sits it down f Indy. SPALKO (cont’d) Oxley lost control of his mind by staring too long into its eyes. Spalko walk to Indy. SPALKO (cont’d) We believe you can get through to him after yo have done the same. She puts a hand on Indy’s cheek, stroking it, trying gent turn him toward the skull.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: I got a better idea. You look at it.

dialogues.speaker: SPALKO
dialogues.text: The skull does not speak to everyone, it seems. Spalko walks back to the skull. SPALKO (cont’d) Surely you’re not afraid, Dr. Jones? You’ve spent your entire life searching for answer, think of the truth behind those eyes. She puts her hands around the skull. Spalko walks to the side of the tent. There is a Scientist seated at a table with a EEG monitor walks up to the table. SPALKO (cont’d) there maybe be hundreds of these skulls at Akator, perhaps thousands. Whoever finds them will control the greatest natural force the world has ever known. (she picks up a stopwatch-and turns to Indy) Power over the mind of man.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Be careful. You might get exactly what you ask for.

dialogues.speaker: SPALKO
dialogues.text: I usually do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spalko starts her stopwatch. Indy smiles. A strange pulsing emanates from the center of the skull, in its eyes. Indy can’t help it, he’s drawn to it -- Indy looks deeply into the skull’s eyes. Immediately, the on the EEG graph spike. The light in the eyes of the skull grows brighter and Ind stare more intense. The EEG readings increase in density. Spalko takes note.  69. SPALKO (cont’d) Imagine -- to peer across the world and know the enemy’s secrets. To place our thoughts in the minds of your leaders -- (she moves towards Indy)-- make your teachers teach the true version of history, your soldiers attack on our orders. Indy couldn’t look away from the skull now if he wanted t Spalko walks around Indy. SPALKO (cont’d) We’1l be everywhere at once, as powerful as a whisper, invading your dreams thinking your thoughts for you while you sleep. Spalko walks back to the stand where the skull is. The veins in Indy’s temples swell; his heartbeat’s visibl them. He can’t speak, he’s caught in the gaze of the skul The EEG needle is going batshit now, jumping all over the scribbling a line so dense it’s almost one solid block of the paper. SPALKO (cont'd) we will change you, Dr. Jones, all of you, from the inside. We will turn YOU into US. Indy’s face is trembling now, red and flushed, and bright capillaries pop out in the whites of his eyes. SPALKO (cont'd) and the best part? You won’t even know it’s happening. Indy still stares into the skull’s eyes, and he starts to now, directly to the skull.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Return.

dialogues.speaker: EXT BY THE CAMPFIRE NIGHT
dialogues.text: And just as Indy says the word “return,” we cut abruptly the campfire, where Oxley is sitting by the campfire, as hearing the word from Indy’s lips, but of course he’s too away. But he repeats it:

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: Return.

dialogues.speaker: EXT BY THE CAMPFIRE NIGHT
dialogues.text: And Oxley continues to stare out.

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: Henry?  75 70.

dialogues.speaker: INT TENT NIGHT
dialogues.text: Back in the tent, the veins in Indy’s temples throb. Mac forward.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: That’s enough! For God’s sake if he dies we can’t get there! Just when it seems Indy can’t take anymore --

dialogues.speaker: SPALKO
dialogues.text: Cover it. She stops the stopwatch. Dovchenko darts in and pull a hood over the skull, breaki Indy’s gaze. Mac gets close to Indy and study his blank expression.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Jonesey, you alright? Indy looks up at him. His eyes focus and he shakes his he mind clearing. Mac unties Indy’s arm. The second Indy’s arm is free -- -- HE PUNCHES MAC IN THE FACE. MAC (cont'd) You broke my nose!

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: I Told you. Indy takes off the head gear, Dovchenko grabs Indy and pu away. Spalko steps up to him, eye to eye.

dialogues.speaker: SPALKO
dialogues.text: Enough. You will speak to Oxley and lead us to Akator. Yes?

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Nyet. Expecting that response, she immediately BARKS an order.

dialogues.speaker: SPALKO
dialogues.text: Take him outside. Two soldiers leapt to attention and --  76 71.

dialogues.speaker: EXT RUSSIAN CAMP NIGHT
dialogues.text: Spalko comes out of the tent, followed by Dovchenko ,and_ Dovchenko throws Indy his hat.. they drag Mutt out of a n tent. They shove him roughly up alongside Indy.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: You alright, kid?

dialogues.speaker: MUTT
dialogues.text: They left my bike in that cemetery!

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: (you don’t understand) Yeah but are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: MUTT
dialogues.text: (you don’t understand) They left my bike! One of the Russian Soldiers holds a polished cherry wood two feet wide, four feet long, with a molded velvet inter the case there are several sabers and foils. She selects a wicked-looking one and approaches Mutt with clearly a threat. MUTT (cont’d) Wait! Don’t! Stop! Geez, the kid panics easily. But Mutt fools us -- he pull comb from his back pocket and runs it through his hair, g just right. And then, to Spalko, utterly fearless: MUTT (cont’d) I’m ready. (to Indy) don’t give these pigs a thing. Indy smiles. Gotta love the kid’s attitude. He looks back Spalko defiantly.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: You heard him.

dialogues.speaker: SPALKO
dialogues.text: Clearly, I have chosen the wrong pressure point.  71A. SPALKO (cont’d) Perhaps I can find a more sensitive one. (to two Soldiers) Privedite zhenshchinu! (bring in the woman )  72. We hear the soldiers grab hold of someone uncooperative, nearby tent. We hear her VOICE before we see her

dialogues.text: One by one, Indy, Marion, Mac, Mutt, and Oxley drag thems onto the riverbank and lie there, GASPING. Indy helps Oxley to dry ground. He walks over to Marion and turns her toward him, making she’s all right. She’s soaked and breathless, but she’s f

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Honey you alright? You okay? He grabs the wheel and yanks it off her hands. Indy looks at her, deep into her eyes for the first time time. He looks exhausted.

Oxley sits, facing away. He takes the burlap bag and plac in front of him, rotating it to face in the direction he’ looking. A low-end vibration starts, barely audible at first, comi the skull. Tiny pebbles and bits of dirt on the ground ar are jumping lightly into the air Indy walks over to Oxley and follows his gaze. There, tow above them, A GREAT STONE HEAD is carved into the cliffs shores of the river.

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: Through eyes that last I saw in tears... Mutt looks up suddenly, recognizing those words.

dialogues.speaker: MUTT
dialogues.text: (finishing the quote) “the golden vision reappears!” It’s T.S. Eliot! You made me read it. (to the others) “Through eyes that last I saw in tears, here in death’s dream kingdom, the golden vision reappears!”

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: gold?! I’m in. Mutt’s still thinking, looking up at the cliff. He sees t waterfall runs out of the left eye of the carved face.

dialogues.speaker: MUTT
dialogues.text: Through eyes in tears, we go through the waterfall! Indy looks at him, impressed, then looks back up at the c  142 143

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: This skull has to be returned. I’11 do it. Nobody else has to come.

dialogues.speaker: MUTT
dialogues.text: Who cares? That thing’s brought us nothing but trouble. (points at Oxley) Look what it did to him.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: I have to return it.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Why you?

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Because ti told(asked) me to.

dialogues.speaker: MUTT
dialogues.text: It asked(told) you to? A hunk of dead rock?

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: (matter-of-fact) What makes you think it’s dead? Slowly, they all turn and look at the skull. We move in c it, and as we draw in --

dialogues.speaker: EXT CLIFFS OF AKATOR DAY
dialogues.text: -- dissolve to that same face, only huge, and carved in r Indy and the others have made their way up the steep face just beside the waterfall that spills out of the giant ey

EXT RIVER’S EDGE DAY The wreckage of the duck that Indy and the others rode ov falls is washed up on the shore of the river. Irina Spalk the few remaining Russian Soldiers, their arms and necks by the pincer marks of the army ants, have just hacked th through the jungle at the rive’s edge. They’re still carr the ropes and other gear they used to rappel down the cli at the river. Spalko picks up one of the diode from the floor, she glan at it. She looks out across the water and sees-- --the Giant Face carved into the cliffs of Akator. She suddenly weakens, overcome by a powerful feeling.

dialogues.speaker: SPALKO
dialogues.text: Into the water.  145 110A.

dialogues.speaker: INT CAVE DAY
dialogues.text: Indy helps Oxley get up into the cave, Marion holds onto Indy leads them into the cave- Mac is holding a flashligh are struck by a cave painting in front of them. CLOSE ON walls as Indy gently touches the first painting, a depict group of squat human figures, hands stretched aloft to th

dialogues.text: (feeling the materials) Ochre... iron oxide....charcoal...

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: How old is this?

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Four, five thousand years, old as the pyramids. Sun worshippers like the Egyptians. While Indy studies the painting, Mutt notices there are a of torch-holders in the walls. There are smears of black above them, and Mutt runs his fingers over them. The resi comes off on his skin.

dialogues.speaker: MUTT
dialogues.text: these are fresh. These were just used. But the others are too distracted by the paintings to pay attention.  111. They move to the next panel. The group of humans are look at the sky as a figure is lowering form the heavens -- hu but taller, thinner, glowing.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: More worshippers.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: That’s not the sun they’re worshipping though. INDY (cont’d) Someone came. They keep moving. There are more alien figures now, and t moving among the human figures, building, farming. INDY (cont’d) Taught the Ugha -- farming, irrigation -- Oxley holding onto the burlap bag with the skull, moves i another room he sees--- The next drawing a more detailed version of the visitor, torso and cranium, in profile. Oxley reaches into his bag, pulls out the Crystal Skull. Indy and the rest of the group enter the room.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Ox, what is it? Indy hands the torch to Mutt and approaches Oxley, he rea the skull. Oxley is hesitant to give it up.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: I understand. Indy takes it and moves closer to the wall .... CHANGED THE ACTION: new action Oxley and the rest of the group enter the room. Marion mo Oxley she puts her hand on his shoulder

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Ox, what is it? Indy hands the torch to Mutt and moves in front of Oxley.  111A.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: I think I understand Ox. Someone came. Indy looks at the painting, mesmerized. Oxley takes the s raises it with his right hand, creating a shadow He holds it up against the painting -- -- and it’s an exact match.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: is this the same as that? (or ) Are they the same? Indy has been looking at another painting behind them.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: It’s not the only one. (or) there were more, look in a circle. He moves to the next picture, a group of shots of a circl taller figures, all grouped around a central area. Oxley moves ahead of them, Indy joins him. INDY (cont’d) Show us the way, Ox. Oxley moves slowly at first, then starts to pick up speed move ahead, into a darker antechamber. It’s harder to mak the paintings here, but the scale is massive. They pass through the cave and into --  146 112.

dialogues.speaker: INT CAVE ROTUNDA DAY
dialogues.text: -- a large rotunda area. Above them, there are thirteen s carved into the ceiling. As they pass underneath, one of skulls OPENS ITS EYES. The eyes follow the humans passing below, and then the th starts to chip away as a form presses into it from above. It’s a REAL Ugha warrior. Now all the skulls start to open their eyes and we realiz are surveillance perches, there’s a whole system of tunne above them. The UGHA WARRIORS SWARM DOWN FROM THE CEILING, they start follow Oxley and the group Indy, Mac, Marion and Mutt stop they hear something. Oxley up ahead stops, listens.

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: “to lay their just hands on that golden Key...that ope’s the Palace of Eternity.” He repeats is several times. Marion joins him.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Shhh, listen. They stop. Indy realizes what is happening.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Let’s go. Go, go, go.... They all take off, barreling through the rotunda toward t sliver of light at the far end. -- The SHRIEKING UGHA WARRIORS ARE FLYING OWN TOWARD THE The Warrior whirls a BOLA BELT over its head (so that was whirling helicopter blade image)  112A. --UGHA WARRIORS SWARM DOWN FROM THE CEILING, jumping, swi climbing down on vines. Indy rips the bola from around Mutt’s neck, drags him to feet, and they all take off, barreling through the rotund the sliver of light at the far end.  147 148 113.

dialogues.text: Mayhem spills out of the mouth of the cave -- Indy, Mac, and Mutt, pursued by a dozen SHRIEKING WARRIORS and WHIRL bolas. Oxley takes off down a set of carved steps toward --

dialogues.speaker: -- AKATOR
dialogues.text: The ruins of the city are set in a hollow depression in t of the plateau-atop-a-plateau, rimmed by clouds, with a h made reservoir carved into the hilltop above it. Though the jungle has grown up around it, we can see its design radiates out from a Great Stone Temple. The pathwa smooth and straight, bordered by aqueducts which carry th flowing from the reservoir above, throughout the city, an plunging down into the base of the temple itself. Indy is running with Oxley, suddenly they are knocked to ground by the bolas. Mac falls. Marion falls. One of the holes WHAPS through the air, wra around Mutt’s neck-- -and SLAMS him to the floor. The warriors surround Marion and Mutt. Mutt takes his kni cuts the bolas off his neck. He moves next to Marion tryi protect her.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Indy!!! Mac sees the Warriors around him and he also yells.

dialogues.speaker: JONESEY
dialogues.text: Indy looks around, knows they’re not going to win this fi SHOUTS to Oxley, desperate:

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Oxley! You were here before, how did you get past ‘em! The warriors move in closer with their spears, suddenly t  114. Oxley gets up with the skull in his hands -- -- and holds it over his head. The skull catches the light of the sun and refracts out t the lensed eyes in brilliant beams. The light streams out everywhere, through the ears, the nose, the mouth, and th HUM we heard before gets louder, the skull vibrating madl actually BLURRING in Oxley’s hands as he holds it over hi To a man, the Ugha warriors freeze in their tracks, start the skull in terrified fascination. Indy grabs onto Oxley as the Ughas shrink back. INDY (cont’d) Oxley, Marion. Indy pulls Oxley along, they make their way towards Mac. are afraid to follow them. INDY (cont’d) C’mon Mac. Mac crawls towards Marion and Mutt.

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: “To lay their just hands on that golden Key...that ope’s the Palace of Eternity.”

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: You did good Ox. They reach Marion and Mutt. They take off, toward the temple in the distance. They reach the temple and scamper up its terraced sides. Ugha do not follow. The Ugha The  149 114A.

dialogues.speaker: ON TOP OF THE STONE TEMPLE,
dialogues.text: the group staggers onto the flat top of the temple. There large square box filled with sand, and a fifteen foot sto obelisk lying on its side. One end of the obelisk is supp a cut-out chunk of hillside, the heavier and lying in the of the stone box. Mac looks around.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: The city of gold, so where’s the gold? He throws a piece of artifact on the ground in disgust. MAC (cont'd) Look at the state of this place! What a stupid legend. What a waste of my time. Indy is standing by the top of the steps with Oxley. Oxle down the steps. Indy follows him. Mutt squats down watching them, Marion stands next to him

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Ox was here before, but he couldn’t get into the temple, so he put the skull back to he cemetery where he found it. Oxley bends down and picks up a handful of sand, he pours Indy’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: “To lay their just hands on that Golden Key... that ope’s the Palace of Eternity.” Indy grins and turns to Oxley, pointing at the obelisk

dialogues.text: Golden key, right? (to the others) This obelisk, is the key to getting into the temple. Indy leans on the obelisk

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: To lay their just hands on that golden key... Oxley starts to walk around the obelisk

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: That’s it, that’s it! Indy follows Oxley around the obelisk

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: That ope’s the Palace of Eternity. Through eyes that last I saw in tears....Here In death’s dream kingdom....gold vision Reappears

dialogues.text: What are you doing Ox? What are you looking for? Oxley stops in front of one of the stone heads. A small t sand is running out from around the edges of a plug of so one of a series of such plugs. INDY (cont’d) You figured(worked) this out in your cell didn’t you Professor? Well done. He gets an idea, goes to pick up a stone. Mac moves in to look at the plugs.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Excuse me Professor. As Mac looks at the stone, Indy , holding a huge chunk of over his head, moves forward toward Mac, ROARING with eff

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Move please. (Just move please Mac) Mac turns and reacts.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Don’t kill me! Mutt’s face lights up, he gets it, he also goes to get a Mac lunges out of the way as Indy SLAMS the rock down on square stone plug at the base of the stone box. Thee plug loose and a stream of sand flows out of the hole.

Now Indy and Mutt move quickly from plug to plug, SMASHIN with rocks, KICKING the plugs out, sand rushing onto the Now Mac and Marion pitch in, kicking plugs out, shoving t away to let the sand flow freely out of the pit. Oxley is seated nearby watching them with a smile. He loo  150 116.

Indy hears the rumble, he stand and looks to see, ten ton stone- aided only by gravity, slowly move to vertical. As the base goes down, the four horizontal pillars, start into the air. Indy and the others watch. The four obelisk click together. The floor of the pit starts to RUMBLE and GROAN The rest of the sand falls away quickly from below the gr they fall through with the sand onto -- A SET OF STAIRS in a darkened area. Indy sits up.

dialogues.speaker: INDY

dialogues.text: A mechanism trips and the steps start to retract, into th The group gets up and starts to descend the stairs. Oxley front, he is holding the skull in his arms wrapped under serape. Indy is behind him. They leap as they race down, to get to the bottom before the steps disappear completel

dialogues.text: Ma! MARION ; Don’t stop for me, keep going. Marion catches up, Mutt gives her his hand, they continue As the group heads down, we drop down to their feet, to t footprints, the stairs getting smaller Indy puts his back against the wall, the other follow, th keep retracting. Indy falls, one by one they all fall. The group has landed on water. Marion is coughing. Mutt sees that Oxley has lost the skull. They begin their search. Mac looks around for gold.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: where’s your gold mate? He finds a coin, puts it away. Indy helps Marion.  116B.

dialogues.text: Are you alright? (You okay?)

dialogues.text: Yeah. Marion embraces Indy, they have a moment and look at each Suddenly Mutt comes up with a soldier skeleton and hands Indy.

dialogues.speaker: MUTT
dialogues.text: Here hold this. He continues to search for the skull in the water. He fin and hands it to Oxley. MUTT (cont’d) Ox, here. Oxley takes it and embraces it.

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: The golden visionary reappears. He covers it. Mutt starts to walk away, stops.

dialogues.speaker: MUTT

dialogues.text: Ugha Warriors lie on the ground riddled with bullets. Irina Spalko walks towards the temple. At the stone steps that lead to Akator, she picks up an identical DIODE flashing. She looks at a tracking device in her hand. She gestures and starts to go up the steps of the temple, soldiers follow her.

dialogues.text: Indy and the others move around the obelisk, they reach t side. Indy finds a torch.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Mac gives us a light. Mac lights it with his lighter. They move into an opening They go through the tunnel and continue to move deeper in temple base. As the group moves on, we drop down to their feet-- --and to the small FLASHING DIODE that one of them (MAC) dropped in their tracks.

dialogues.text: A hundred feet below ground level, Indy, Marion, Oxley, M Mac enter a corridor, away from the sunlight above. But t light seems to follow them, streaming through strategical placed fissures in the temple walls and bouncing off smoo polished areas on the stone surfaces. As they move on, they notice precious jewels, set in orna silver settings and hung upon the walls. Mac CHIPS one ou the wall, drops it in his pocket, grinning to himself as studies the dozens ahead. Indy leads them to a large opening, in the middle of the are large quartz shapes hanging in the ceiling. Mutt move closer and touches one of them.

dialogues.speaker: MUTT
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: I have no idea. (you’re asking me?) Indy moves on, they all follow.

dialogues.text: The group come down the stairs into an opening. Indy puts torch down and heads down, the group follows him The room is very different, it is full of things. Mac studies the room, but it’s the bracelets and rings th interested in.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: That’s more like it! They walk cross further into the room. There are niches all over the wall, crammed with antiquit from every era imaginable. Indy marvels at them:

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Artifacts, from every era of mankind(early history). Macedonian...Sumerian...

dialogues.speaker: MUTT
dialogues.text: This place is the mother lode.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Struscan...Babylonian...

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: there’s not a museum on earth(in the world) wouldn’t sell its soul for this lot.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Early Egyptian.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: A dozen museums, a hundred of them, Jonesy! Mac walks away.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Collectors. (a grin) They were archaeologists. (he realizes that Ox is not next to him) Ox? , Ox? Oxley walked over to the side of the chamber, there are t doors, seemingly carved from a single giant block of iron He uncovers the skull, the skull starts to vibrate.

Mac walks around the room and begins to fill his pockets coins, jewelry and precious stones. Marion walks over the touches the skull, she takes her ha Mutt joins them and also touches the vibrating skull, Ind them.

dialogues.speaker: MUTT
dialogues.text: How do we open it? Indy looks and sees the recess that is over the head of t And it’s empty. Indy sizes it up, thinking. He turns to Oxley and reaches for the skull. Oxley hesita Indy puts his hands gently on the skull.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: I’1l give it back, Harold. Reluctantly, Oxley lets it go. INDY (cont’d) I promise. Indy moves to the door and shoves the Crystal Skull into recess above the door. It fits perfectly, as if the reces mold. Immediately, the skull glows, brighter than it ever had, at once-- Indy steps back to the group. Mac joins them, he is now loaded with bracelets and rings pockets and around his neck. The doors begin to GROAN, the arrows comes down pushing t balls down, the zig zag door opens. They RUMBLE open slow SLAM all the way to he bottom, revealing--  155 119A.

dialogues.speaker: INT TEMPLE HEART DAY
dialogues.text: -- a blindingly lit room. Indy pulls the skull free from the recess, hops back to t ground, and hands it back to Oxley. They all come inside, blinking at the room’s radiance. It’s round, built in the style of the time, along the lin throne room. Carved totems fill every nook and crannny. And there, seated upright in a circle atop a massive circ altar are THIRTEEN FLAWLESS CRYSTAL SKELETONS, nearly sev tall each. Oxley sees one in particular--because it has no skull ato shoulders. Oxley still holding the skull, starts to walk toward the altar that holds the headless body--

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: (softly, to the skull) No more forever waiting soon now. Oxley uncovers the skull and aims it towards the altar. They all stare transfixed --
-- and Indy hears a CLICK behind him. He turns around. Mac_is pointing a gun at them.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Sorry, old son(Jonesy)

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Why don’t you make up your mind, which side our on?

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: I’m getting REALLY tired of this guy.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: (calling out) Ya evo poimal! (got him) And now, from the entrance to the final chamber -- -- the four Russian Soldier step into the room. Indy looks back at Mac, more irritated than anything.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: So you’re what? A triple agent?

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Nah, I just lied about being a double. (to Marion) Don’t worry, you can come with us.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: HAH! Fat chance.
Spalko enters the room, a rush runs through her body, and looks up at the others, eyes shining.

dialogues.speaker: SPALKO
dialogues.text: Look at them. She comes up the steps . SPALKO (cont’d) Still waiting. For the return of the one who was lost. She looks around the room at the twelve others. SPALKO (cont’d) They’re a hive mind, one being, physically separate, but with a collective consciousness. More powerful together than they could ever be apart. She walks up to Oxley and gently takes the Crystal Skull Oxley’s hands and regards it, alas-poor-Yorick style. SPALKO (cont’d) Imagine what they’1l tell us. She walks toward the altar that contains the headless bod

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: I can’t imagine. (she turns, looks at him) Neither could the humans who built this temple, and neither can you. She starts to climb the altar, toward the mummy.

dialogues.speaker: SPALKO
dialogues.text: Belief, Dr. Jones, is a gift you have yet to receive. My sympathies.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Oh, I believe, sister. That’s why I’m down here. Atop the altar now, she raises the skull toward the mummy Magnetic field grabs it out of her hand, pulling it forwa -- and sucking it into place atop the mummy’s shoulders.

A RUMBLING rises up in the room, the bodies themselves be vibrate. Viscous fluids flow through the stone, these were living and they’re coming back to life. The main skeleton, the o which the Crystal skull was returned, blurs and its flesh returns, soft, living flesh once again, eyes that see, ha move. Spalko backs up back to the group. Oxley, who is staring at the skeleton, transfixed, moves the altar and begins to speak, low and rapid. But it isn’ English, it’s-- Indy and Spalko move next to Oxley INDY (cont’d) Mayan. He’s speaking Mayan.

dialogues.speaker: SPALKO
dialogues.text: What does he say? Oxley’s lips moving rapidly, strange, ancient sounds comi of his mouth. Indy listens, Oxley, is still talking. Indy tries to deci

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: He says he’s grateful, he wants-- (correcting himself, he means the skeleton) -- Indy turns and looks at the skeleton. INDY (cont’d) --it wants to give us a gift. The Being seems to look right back at him. Spalko moves c the altar. INDY (cont’d) A big gift. Spalko is speaking to the figure on the altar, low, ferve almost a prayer.

dialogues.speaker: SPALKO
dialogues.text: Tell me-- everything you know, I want it all, I want to know -- The skeleton sees her and seems to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something has begun. Indy moves back next to Mutt.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: I’ve got a bad feeling about this. Spalko is transfixed. She locks eyes with the Main skelet Marion is amazed too staring at them.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Indy, their eyes! -- the RUMBLING grows louder, and the stone walls of the crack and crumble. Mac knows a bad situation when he sees it. He takes off o the opening is starting to move away, he ducks out into t tunnel that leads to the antechamber. The sides of the room start to spin, slowly at first, but speed, like a centrifuge.

dialogues.speaker: MUTT
dialogues.text: What are they, space-men?! Harold Oxley is suddenly and completely restored to his n self.

dialogues.speaker: 122B.
dialogues.text: 10/2/07 The soldiers chase after them, they are sucked up into th ceiling by the spinning walls. Spalko’s face glows in the brilliant light of the Skull’s eyes. The walls of the roo blur of motion now. The skeletons surround her But Spalko remains, still staring into the eyes again.

dialogues.speaker: SPALKO
dialogues.text: I want to know! I want to know! I can see, I can see. Cover it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the throne room, the walls are spinning faster now, continues to stare, eyes wide, temples throbbing. This she came for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More Spalko Spalko is what

dialogues.text: Mac comes out of the tunnel and starts to head up the sta stops and heads back down, he starts to pick up more loot Oxley with Marion come through the tunnel. Marion wants t back, Oxley stops her.

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY

dialogues.text: I am fine. Marion goes to Indy, they embrace. Mutt goes to Oxley. MUTT (cont’d) Ox? Do you know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: Multiple dimensions! Fascinating to ponder Mutt! Mignon Thorne wrote an interesting perspective, teased out the notion of changeable physics -- Indy realizes that something is happening.

dialogues.speaker: NOT A GOOD TIME FOR THIS, OX
dialogues.text: He pushes them up the stairs. Indy stops, Mac comes up fr behind the artifacts.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: I winked(I always winked). Indy puts his finger up.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Nyet. The look at each other. Indy joins the group and they hea Mac goes back to gathering more loot.

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: Changeable physics a bit like eddy in water, what with hot and cold spots, see that Thm anthinn +9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: te %

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy stops at the top of the stairs, he turns and calls M

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Mac come on! Mac! Mac keeps picking up more stuff. Indy goes down closer to INDY (cont’d) Mac! Now! Mac looks at him, but he moves to another area and keeps up things. INDY (cont’d) Mac! Damn it! Behind Mac, the black sinkhole is coming forward. Mac tur moves towards Indy, he’s pulled to the ground. The sinkhole is advancing toward Mac, and the denseness o gravity is pulling him and everything else toward it-- Mac looks up at Indy, knows he’s in a serious jam. Indy takes out his whip and throws the handle to Mac. Mac onto it. Mac continues to be drawn toward the pit INDY (cont’d) Come on Mac, use your feet (legs). I can’t do it alone. Mac’s face falls, there’s no way out of this.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Jonesy I’m gonna be alright. He winks. He lets go of the whip, his body is immediately into the void. Indy falls back onto the stairs, takes one last look stan heads out with the rest of the group. The stairs right be them are behind sucked away.

TEMPLE HEART -DAY the sides of the temple room whirl faster and faster, jus now, and Spalko tears her away from the gaze of the bodie they’re facing, but when she turns around-- --ONE OF THE BODIES IS STANDING RIGHT BEHIND HER. It seems impossible that it got there so quickly, but the its eyes, shining even BRIGHTER, so she turns again-- --and THERE’S TWO MORE OF THEM on the other side of her, there, eyes beaming righter still.

But there’s no one left to cover it and she’s in he cente circle, so everywhere she turns, there is a body standing there, its eyes burning like laser beams. Spalko starts to BABBLE in that alien language the body s otherworldly sounds coming out of her, fast, and now she as it all pours into her, too much, far too much, the vei her temples throb and swell -- -- her eyes drip blood, but she doesn’t collapse, she sta her feet. Smoke curls up from her eyes, her eyeballs flutter and bo if her brain is boiling water and they’re floating on top she SCREAMS -- SPALKO (cont’d) I can still see!!! -- GEYSERS OF FLAME burst from her eyes. It flairs up, hollowing out her eye sockets, and whatever left of her eyes burns out and drips down her face, dark, matter -- -- and her arms drop to her sides, lifeless, revealing tw oversized, black, hollow eye sockets, just like the corps outside the door. She falls to the ground, dead. And at that very moment, the Thirteen Crystal Skeletons b vanish, one by one. They don’t disappear, or get in a shi fly away, it’s more that they slip away, turning sideways sliding into thin air, or another dimension, or someplace cannot grasp. The sinkhole in the center of the room both implodes and at the same time, sucking everything into it and expandin same time.

dialogues.speaker: INT TEMPLE CORRIDOR DAY
dialogues.text: Indy and the others race into the corridor with the quart hangings from the ceiling. Everything continues to get su back into the sinkhole. Oxley’s still making his point.

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: Migno Thorne called them, “Post- inflation bubbles,” assuming universal expansion- - Indy runs to one end of the hallways, the walls are EXPLO with rocks blocking the way out. Indy runs back to anothe corridor. OXLEY (cont'd) --and therefore random pockets of extrinsic physics--

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Ox!

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Ox shut up! Indy takes off, they all follow.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TEMPLE CORRIDOR DAY
dialogues.text: Indy and the group come out to an opening.

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: (finishing)-- different realities could reside in the same space at the same time, completely unaware of one another They see a huge set of sets, with huge turbines on both s group heads up. The turbines crashing behind them, water everywhere. They reach the top and go around another set of turbines. The group continue to run. Just then, with a great CRACK, walls around them split and water races towards them.

dialogues.speaker: INT TEMPLE
dialogues.text: They race through an ascending tunnel. Its walls are made quartz, and through it they can see thousands of tons of flowing around them. They reach a dead end. They look up and see an opening. R of water gets louder towards them . Water cascades into the quartz tunnel, ROARING up behind It overtakes them, sweeping them along, the tunnel fills a whirlpool begins- forcing them upward --they swirl all up --

dialogues.speaker: EXT AKATOR DUSK
dialogues.text: -- and EXPLODING out the top of the tunnel, some distance form the temple itself. They land on the side of the clif surround Akator, a short distance from the top. Behind them, the Great Stone Temple is crumbling, collaps its center area, debris of all kinds whirling as if in a centrifuge.

dialogues.speaker: EXT PLATEAU
dialogues.text: The four survivors scramble up a small incline as_ behind the Great Stone Temple completely flattens with a giganti devastating the entire plateau as its great weight drops once, filling the space created by the giant sinkhole. The four survivors duck for cover, behind the rocks. The huge cloud of whirling debris still spins around a gl orb in the center, it’s the base of the temple, the spinn shining, silvery walls that surrounded the temple room. But now the orb itself turns sideways and vanishes, and a does, the giant cloud of debris is sucked onto the tiny d which the orb disappeared, leaving not a speck of dust be evidence. When this last bit of support is yanked from th landscape, the cliffs around it collapse and, with a soun bedsheet RIPPING in half -- -- the great reservoir on the hillside across from them C half, sending its ocean of water cascading down over the the city, flowing over the rubble and filling up the spac the Red Sea flowing back into place.
Indy, Marion, Mutt, and Oxley collapsed on the hillside a churning waters settle, turning what was once the greates of all time into a peaceful mountain lake Indy stands and looks out.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Did you see that?

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: Like a broom to their footprints... It’s dusk now, and the first stars are coming out. Slowly sounds of the jungle return.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Where did they go? (looks up) Space?

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: Not into space. Into the space -- -- between spaces. Indy looks at his frail, scholarly old friend is wonder.

dialogues.speaker: MUTT
dialogues.text: (looking down at the ruins) I don’t get it. The legend said it was suppose to be a city of gold.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: The Ugha word for gold translates as “treasure.” But the treasure wasn’t gold, it was knowledge. Knowledge was their treasure. Marion walks up to Mutt and touches his face near the wid that has re-opened down his right cheek.

dialogues.speaker: MARION
dialogues.text: Oh, honey, you’re going to have a nasty scar.

dialogues.speaker: MUTT
dialogues.text: I know. Indy moves back and leans against a rock, everything hurt everywhere. He motions for Marion to join him, she sits n him. They look at each other and embrace.
It’s getting dark. MUTT (cont’d) what, we’re just gonna sit here?

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Night falls quick in the jungle, kid. You don’t want to climb down the mountain in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: MUTT
dialogues.text: No, I can. Who’s coming with me? He heads down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Why don’t you stick around, Junior? Mutt stops, turns and looks at Indy.

dialogues.speaker: MUTT
dialogues.text: I don’t know, why didn’t you, Dad? Oxley turns and looks at them, sweetly puzzled again.

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: “Dad?” (looking at Indy, then turns and looks at Mutt) Dad? Indy pushes back his hat and looks up.

dialogues.speaker: INDY
dialogues.text: Somewhere an old man is laughing.( or - somewhere your grandpa is laughing)

dialogues.speaker: INT CAMPUS BUILDING DAY
dialogues.text: Dean Stanforth, the dean of Indy’s college, hurries down corridor in the college building. He’s dressed in his Sun best, seems terribly late for something. But he stops for a moment outside the door to an office. PAINTER is standing in front of a certain door, adding to stencilled name on its frosted glass panel. On the top line it says "PROFESSOR HENRY JONES JR.” But o line just below it, the Painter is adding two words:

dialogues.speaker: ASSOCIATE DEAN
dialogues.text: The Painter is just finishing the last N. Stanforth hesit smiling. The Painter looks over his shoulder, am I doing something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: STANFORTH
dialogues.text: Marvelous, perfect. Make the letters bigger, much bigger The Painter returns to his work as Stanforth hurries down hall again, ducking into his own office-- INT. STANFORTH’S OFFICE-DAY --where he runs in and heads for his desk. Opens the draw finds a certain book and pulls it out. It’s a tattered old Bible, the kind that’s been in a fami years. From the Bible in Stanforth’s hands, we--

dialogues.speaker: INT CHAPEL DAY
dialogues.text: --cut the same Bible, now held in the hands of a SERIOUS MINISTER, standing at the front of an impressive church. Indy, dressed in a suit and bow tie, stands before him, a Marion’s next to him, looking radiant in a simple white s Mutt’s just beside Indy, in a sharp suit and tie.

dialogues.speaker: MINISTER
dialogues.text: Henry Jones, Jr. and Marion Ravenwood, in so much as the two of you have agreed to live together in Holy Matrimony, have promised your love for each other by these vows, the joining of your hands and the giving of these rings, I now declare you to be Husband and Wife. Whom God hath joined together, let no one put asunder. Stanforth sits in the first row, smiling happily, his WIF him. Harold Oxley is next to them, washed and brushed up looking fine.

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: Ahh, “how much of human life is lost in waiting.” Up front, the Serious Minister drones on.

dialogues.speaker: MINISTER
dialogues.text: Congratulations, you may kiss your bride. Marion hands her flowers to the Minister and impulsively and kisses Indy. The small crowd CLAPS and Oxley leaps to his feet, cheeri The couple with Mutt head down to meet the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: OXLEY
dialogues.text: Well done, Henry! At the sound of their shared name, Indy and Mutt both tur grin and speak at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: INDY MUTT
dialogues.text: Thanks, Ox! Thanks, Ox! The Serious Minister wraps it up.

Mutt moves to one of the pews and grabs his camera, gets take a photo. The front doors of the church blow open. A breeze rushes familiar fedora blows right off its hook and rolls down t center aisle, coming to rest at the toes of a pair of scu motorcycle boots. Mutt picks up the hat, dusts it off, and looks at it. He hesitates for a moment, then raises it to his own head, m just to see if it fits, he’s got it halfway there but -- -- A HAND reaches in. Indy snatches the hat away from Mut him a look, and puts the battered old fedora back, the on it belongs, on his own head. Indiana Jones holds his arm out for Marion, she takes it, they walk out through the open doors that lead to anywher The crowd follows, leaving Mutt standing alone. He takes leather jacket and camera and heads out. FADE OUT.
